title: Security Management Process
text: Implement policies and procedures to prevent, detect, contain, and correct security violations

title: Risk Analysis
text: Conduct an accurate and thorough assessment of the potential risks and vulnerabilities to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of ePHI

title: Risk Management
text: Implement security measures sufficient to reduce risks and vulnerabilities to a reasonable and appropriate level

title: Sanction Policy
text: Apply appropriate sanctions against workforce members who fail to comply with security policies and procedures

title: Information System Activity Review
text: Implement procedures to regularly review records of information system activity, such as audit logs, access reports, and security incident tracking reports

title: Assigned Security Responsibility
text: Identify the security official who is responsible for the development and implementation of security policies and procedures

title: Workforce Security
text: Implement policies and procedures to ensure that all workforce members have appropriate access to ePHI

title: Authorization and/or Supervision
text: Implement procedures for authorization and/or supervision of workforce members who work with ePHI

title: Workforce Clearance Procedure
text: Implement procedures to determine that workforce member access to ePHI is appropriate

title: Termination Procedures
text: Implement procedures for terminating access to ePHI when employment or other arrangements end

title: Information Access Management
text: Implement policies and procedures for authorizing access to ePHI that are consistent with applicable requirements

title: Isolating Health Care Clearinghouse Function
text: If a health care clearinghouse is part of a larger organization, implement policies to protect ePHI from unauthorized access by the larger organization

title: Access Authorization
text: Implement policies and procedures for granting access to ePHI

title: Access Establishment and Modification
text: Implement policies and procedures that establish, document, review, and modify a user's right of access to ePHI

title: Security Awareness and Training
text: Implement a security awareness and training program for all members of the workforce

title: Security Reminders
text: Provide periodic security updates and reminders

title: Protection from Malicious Software
text: Implement procedures for guarding against, detecting, and reporting malicious software

title: Log-in Monitoring
text: Implement procedures for monitoring log-in attempts and reporting discrepancies

title: Password Management
text: Implement procedures for creating, changing, and safeguarding passwords

title: Security Incident Procedures
text: Implement policies and procedures to address security incidents

title: Response and Reporting
text: Identify and respond to suspected or known security incidents; mitigate harmful effects; document incidents and outcomes

title: Contingency Plan
text: Establish and implement policies and procedures for responding to an emergency or other occurrence that damages systems containing ePHI

title: Data Backup Plan
text: Establish and implement procedures to create and maintain retrievable exact copies of ePHI

title: Disaster Recovery Plan
text: Establish and implement procedures to restore loss of data

title: Emergency Mode Operation Plan
text: Establish and implement procedures to enable continuation of critical business processes while operating in emergency mode

title: Testing and Revision Procedures
text: Implement procedures for periodic testing and revision of contingency plans

title: Applications and Data Criticality Analysis
text: Assess the relative criticality of specific applications and data in support of other contingency plan components

title: Evaluation
text: Perform a periodic technical and nontechnical evaluation based on standards implemented to assess security

title: Business Associate Contracts and Other Arrangements
text: Ensure business associates provide satisfactory assurances that they will appropriately safeguard ePHI

title: Written Contract or Other Arrangement
text: Document satisfactory assurances through written contracts that meet applicable requirements

title: Facility Access Controls
text: Implement policies and procedures to limit physical access to electronic information systems and facilities while ensuring authorized access

title: Contingency Operations
text: Establish procedures to allow facility access in support of data restoration under disaster recovery and emergency operations

title: Facility Security Plan
text: Implement policies and procedures to safeguard the facility and equipment from unauthorized physical access, tampering, and theft

title: Access Control and Validation Procedures
text: Implement procedures to control and validate a person's access to facilities based on role or function

title: Maintenance Records
text: Implement policies and procedures to document repairs and modifications to physical components of a facility related to security

title: Workstation Use
text: Implement policies and procedures that specify proper functions to be performed and the manner in which those functions are to be performed on workstations accessing ePHI

title: Workstation Security
text: Implement physical safeguards for all workstations that access ePHI to restrict access to authorized users

title: Device and Media Controls
text: Implement policies and procedures that govern receipt and removal of hardware and electronic media containing ePHI

title: Disposal
text: Implement policies and procedures to address final disposition of ePHI and hardware or electronic media on which it is stored

title: Media Re-use
text: Implement procedures for removal of ePHI from electronic media before media are made available for re-use

title: Accountability
text: Maintain a record of movements of hardware and electronic media and any person responsible for movements

title: Data Backup and Storage
text: Create a retrievable exact copy of ePHI before movement of equipment

title: Access Control
text: Implement technical policies and procedures for systems that maintain ePHI to allow access only to authorized persons or software programs

title: Unique User Identification
text: Assign a unique name and/or number for identifying and tracking user identity

title: Emergency Access Procedure
text: Establish and implement procedures for obtaining necessary ePHI during an emergency

title: Automatic Logoff
text: Implement electronic procedures that terminate an electronic session after a predetermined time of inactivity

title: Encryption and Decryption
text: Implement a mechanism to encrypt and decrypt ePHI

title: Audit Controls
text: Implement hardware, software, and procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in information systems containing ePHI

title: Integrity
text: Implement policies and procedures to protect ePHI from improper alteration or destruction

title: Mechanism to Authenticate ePHI
text: Implement electronic mechanisms to corroborate that ePHI has not been altered or destroyed in an unauthorized manner

title: Person or Entity Authentication
text: Implement procedures to verify that a person or entity seeking access to ePHI is the one claimed

title: Transmission Security
text: Implement technical security measures to guard against unauthorized access to ePHI transmitted over electronic networks

title: Integrity Controls
text: Implement security measures to ensure electronically transmitted ePHI is not improperly modified without detection

title: Encryption
text: Implement a mechanism to encrypt ePHI whenever deemed appropriate

title: Business Associate Contracts or Other Arrangements
text: Covered entities must have written contracts with business associates that ensure appropriate safeguards for ePHI

title: Requirements for Group Health Plans
text: Group health plans must ensure plan documents incorporate provisions to establish permitted and required uses and disclosures of ePHI by plan sponsor

title: Policies and Procedures
text: Implement reasonable and appropriate policies and procedures to comply with standards, implementation specifications, or other requirements

title: Documentation
text: Maintain written policies and procedures, maintain documentation of actions, activities, or assessments required by this subpart in written or electronic form

title: Time Limit
text: Retain documentation for 6 years from date of creation or last effective date, whichever is later

title: Availability
text: Make documentation available to those responsible for implementing procedures to which documentation pertains

title: Updates
text: Review documentation periodically and update as needed in response to environmental or operational changes
